channel.title: list on Kevin Cui
channel.description: Recent content in list on Kevin Cui

item.title: Replace 8 Frequently Used Linux Commands!?
item.description: .lnt { display: none } Almost a decade ago, I started to touch the command-line interface (CLI). I’m now a nerdy CLI lover and I’m so obsessed by its efficiency. Therefore, I’m always trying out new command-line commands. From time to time, some commands are replaced by other improved ones in my daily workflow. Especially for some frequently used commands, it’s worth to find better alternatives. Here is a list of improved commands I’d like to share with you:

item.title: My Toolbox
item.description: Software Testing 🌏👉 Test case generator (pairwise) 📖👉 Test Heuristics Cheat Sheet 📖👉 1-page usability test plan 📀👉 faker-cli: generate massive amounts of fake data 📀👉 Radamsa: Radamsa is a test case generator for robustness testing, a.k.a. a fuzzer 📀👉 Ruby Pairwise: Ruby based tool for selecting a smaller number of test input combinations 🌏👉 Name: all about name 🌏👉 Big List of Naughty Strings: list of strings which have a high probability of causing issues
